00022 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00023 //
00024 //  Contains basic image information.It has the size of cluster.Each grid
00025 //  point is represented as one array cell.
00026 //  Base array contains universal feeds.One universal feed is a list of 
00027 //  points.
00028 //  Array criLines contains lists of critical points CriCandidate laying 
00029 //  under one  of the mirror axises or universal feeds belonging to
00030 //  different sectors. 
00031 //  Array map contains image information for each grid point:
00032 //        layers -  bits are set if coresponding layer is present
00033 //                  in basic image
00034 //        visited - not used (set to 0)
00035 //        termNo  - not used  -''-
00036 //        criAreaNo - if this grid belongs to critical area then here
00037 //                  there's it's number ( equal position in criLines +1)
00038 //                  otherwise  set to 0
00039 //        uniNo   - number of restricted feed (position in base array) if
00040 //                  exists in this point
00041 //        xxxWay  - these fields are filled if around there\'re another
00042 //                  points connected with actual point.
00043 class  ImageMap : public  Array
00044 {
00045     public :
00046 
00047      ImageMap(int,int,int **stamp);
00048      ~ImageMap();
00049 
00050   virtual classType       myNo() const { return ImageMapClass; }
00051   virtual char           *myName()const { return "ImageMap"; }
00052 
00053 
00054     friend  class LayMap;
00055           
00056           int             addFeeds(List&,layerType);
00057           void            criticalIsland(List& ,layerType );
00058           void            criticalFeed(List& );
00059           void            clearFeedNo( void  );
00060           clusterMapType  recognizeNeighbors(int,int);
00061 
00062     private  :
00063 
00064 
00065 
00066     layoutMapType   **map;  
00067     Array           criLines;
00068     int             **tmpStamp;
00069 
00070     int rows;
00071     int cols;
00072 
00073 
00074 
00075 };
